body_html:
Cmake build is community supported except for windows.
on windows, all seems to be working at master now, so there is nothing to do there for us.
http://ci.tensorflow.org/job/tf-master-win-gpu-cmake/1373/

The initial reported issue, what happens if you add CUDA include paths to your compile command? I am not sure if TF should package cuda.h, so it may be better to make your command use the cuda headers installed on your system.
body_text:
Cmake build is community supported except for windows.
on windows, all seems to be working at master now, so there is nothing to do there for us.
http://ci.tensorflow.org/job/tf-master-win-gpu-cmake/1373/
The initial reported issue, what happens if you add CUDA include paths to your compile command? I am not sure if TF should package cuda.h, so it may be better to make your command use the cuda headers installed on your system.
body:
Cmake build is community supported except for windows.
on windows, all seems to be working at master now, so there is nothing to do there for us.
http://ci.tensorflow.org/job/tf-master-win-gpu-cmake/1373/

The initial reported issue, what happens if you add CUDA include paths to your compile command? I am not sure if TF should package cuda.h, so it may be better to make your command use the cuda headers installed on your system.
